alert.note: Alert for Lower Snake River Plain; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 3:41AM MST until January 18 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and wind expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 MPH. * WHERE...The upper and lower Snake River Plain, including but not limited to Idaho Falls, Ammon, Rexburg, Rigby, St. Anthony, Pocatello, Chubbuck, Blackfoot, American Falls, Shelley, Aberdeen, and Fort Hall. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 11 PM this evening to 2 PM Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained at 511.idaho.gov.
